ngx-translate is an Angular internationalization library that allows you to set translations for your visible content across many languages and simply switch between them.

dailyPosts.title: [Angular] Pipes in depth - Pure or Impure?
dailyPosts.description: Probably every Angular developer has already met with the definition of Pipes. Pipes are special classes that have the @Pipe decorator declared above them. In short, Pipes are useful for transforming data. For example, when we have an object property that is originally a date, but we want to make it appear in a prettier form, we should pass that Date object to a date pipe and that way we could modify the appearance of it.

dailyPosts.title: The cleanest way to write observable chains
dailyPosts.description:
I am often faced with the case where I need to persist the output of one observable but also use it as the input for other observables. I run into the challenge on how to organize the information cleanly. I am often faced with the following scenario:
I have one observable that emits a value that I need to save and show on the UI
A second observable that needs the value of the first to perform its function.

dailyPosts.title: RxJS based state management in Angular - Part IV
dailyPosts.description:
Challenge: local state
Small and medium scale apps, usually display the list of data once in an app, and in almost the same shape, but the case of the params is different. If you update the param state with a new page of the employees list, you do not expect it to update for companies list as well. So the Param State is actually always local, and should not be provided in root. This is to prevent developers from overlapping params. It should be provided locally, and here is how.

dailyPosts.title: How Mapping Operators can help you to avoid multiple subscriptions in Angular
dailyPosts.description: In this article, I will talk about Rxjs mapping operators. These operators are used to avoid multiple subscriptions This is also known as flattening. There are 3 mapping operators we can use to solve this issue. So the three mapping operators are switchMap, mergeMap, concatMap which are used to work to reduce multiple subscriptions. These operators are mostly used with API calls.

dailyPosts.title: Absolute and Relative Route Paths | Angular Routing | Angular 13+
dailyPosts.description:
When we specify a path to a route in angular, that path can be an absolute path or relative path. Based on that, the final route path is determined. So, a route path in Angular can be:
1. Absolute path: We can specify absolute path for a route by using a forward slash before the path. In that case, that path will be appended to root URL.
2. Relative path: When we don't specify a forward slash before the route path, that means we are specifying relative path. The relative path is appended to the currently active route.
In this lecture, let's learn about absolute and relative path with an example.

dailyPosts.title: What is Child Routes in Angular | Angular Routing | Angular 13+
dailyPosts.description:
In this lecture, we will have a look at how to add a child or nested routes to an Angular route. Child Routes or Nested routes are a powerful new feature in the Angular router.
Nested routes are routes within other routes. In this lecture, i will show you how to create a child route and display the child components. The Angular allows us to nest child routes under another child routes effectively creating a Tree of routes.
